issue.title: ConvertibleTo prose does not match code

discussion.p: The prose in N4800 subclause indicates that the requirement is for an expression of a particular type and value category to be both implicitly and explicitly convertible to some other type. However, for a type
ConvertibleTo<const A, A> would be false despite the following being okay:
discussion.note: 2019-03-15 Priority set to 1 after reflector discussion
2019-07-14 Tim adds PR based on discussion in 2019-07-09 LWG telecon

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4820, and also resolves LWG .

blockquote.p: -1- The ConvertibleTo concept requires ana glvalue expression of a particular type and value category to be both implicitly and explicitly convertible to some other type. The implicit and explicit conversions are required to produce equal results.
-2- Let test be the invented function:

for some types From and To, and let f be a function with no arguments and return type add_rvalue_reference_t<From> such that f() is equality-preserving. From and To model ConvertibleTo<From, To> only if:

li.p: (2.1) — To is not an object or reference-to-object type, or static_cast<To>(f()) is equal to test(f).
(2.2) — add_rvalue_reference_t<From> is not a reference-to-object type, or

(2.2.1) — If add_rvalue_reference_t<From> is an rvalue reference to a non const-qualified type, the resulting state of the object referenced by f() after either above expression is valid but unspecified ().
(2.2.2) — Otherwise, the object referred to by f() is not modified by either above expression.
